column4: has anyone tried to install ubuntu and kubuntu on the same machine as dual boot? i like them both, but i don't like to install one on top of another since the menus become full of apps...
i don't know about kubuntu but in ubuntu i can make apps "invisible" in the menu
that shouldn't be the case, but i don't see any reason why you can't dualboot them

only thing you have to realise is that the installers probably won't add the right entries to grub by default, but you can just open /boot/grub/menu.lst and edit it (the "other" menu.lst should already contain the entry you need to boot it, so you cna just copy paste)
